title: Fun times for Next Capital's Funlab Group
text:
Private equity firm Next Capital is expected to target a mid-to-high teens multiple for leisure and entertainment company Funlab.

Stockbrokers JPMorgan and Citi kicked off marketing for Funlab's mooted initial public offering on Wednesday, sending detailed pre-deal marketing reports to fund managers and teeing up investor meetings.

While both brokers stopped short of putting hard values on the IPO contender - in light of ASIC's RG246 - the analysts were pointing towards a high-teens type valuation for Funlab.

Bowling alley owner Funlab Group has big plans to roll-out more venues.

The analysts told clients Funlab expected $152.4 million operating revenue in the 2020 financial year and $29.2 million in earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation.

A high-teens valuation would imply a market capitalisation up towards $500 million, should Funlab make it to the ASX-boards.
description: Next Capital is expected to target a mid-to-high teens multiple for leisure and entertainment company Funlab.
